AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: rural area with limited traffic, mostly used by local residents and workers, where vehicles with out-of-town registrations raised suspicions, frequently used as a smuggling route, described as having no shoulder and being 'real narrow' with 'sharp turns', adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot, location of drop-offs, primarily used by farmers and oil field workers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint: location where border patrol agents inspect vehicles and process individuals, relevant to the events' context
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.wind farm near Farm-to-Market Road 2050: location near FM 2050 with windmills extending out to the west across various ranches, approximately a mile and a half north of where Agent Trevino initiated a stop, has employees who regularly drive through the checkpoint
